argument.name: index_name
argument.description: The name of an index or query list. A NULL ("") string the form's sort order to record number order.

section.description: The <OBJECT>.INDEX_SET() method selects an index or query list as the primary index. This method is a wrapper for <TBL>.INDEX_PRIMARY_PUT(). Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script is attached to a button on a form. It sets the form's sort order to record number order:
This script is attached to a button on a form. It displays a dialog with a list of indexes and queries, and allows the user to select an index/query.
section.example: dim list[count] as C t = table.current() 'count the number of indexes/queries count = 1 while (t.index_name_get(count) != "") count = count + 1 end while count = count - 1 'create an array with the index names for I = 1 to count list[I] = t.index_name_get(I) next i index_name = ui_get_list_array("Choose an index", 1, "list") parentform.index_set(index_name)

&ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SET() Syntax Result_Flag as L = &ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SET( [ Index_Name as C ] ) ArgumentDescription Result_Flag Index_NameThe name of an index or query list. A NULL ("") string the form's sort order to record number order.
Description The &ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SET() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.INDEX_SET() method selects an index or query list as the primary index. This method is a wrapper for <TBL>.INDEX_PRIMARY_PUT(). Limitations Desktop applications only. Example This script is attached to a button on a form. It sets the form's sort order to record number order: parentform.index_set("")
This script is attached to a button on a form. It displays a dialog with a list of indexes and queries, and allows the user to select an index/query. dim list[count] as C t = table.current() 'count the number of indexes/queries count = 1 while (t.index_name_get(count) != "") count = count + 1 end while count = count - 1 'create an array with the index names for I = 1 to count list[I] = t.index_name_get(I) next i index_name = ui_get_list_array("Choose an index", 1, "list") parentform.index_set(index_name)
For more examples, see the <FORM>.FIND() method. See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
